meanings.definition: To set on fire or ignite
meanings.sent1: She imblazed the campfire with a matchstick.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display imblazed the night sky with colors.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally imblazed the dish, creating a smoky flavor.
meanings.sent4: His passionate speech imblazed the audience with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The sun imblazing the horizon was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To make something prominent or noticeable
meanings.sent1: Her smile imblazed her face with joy.
meanings.sent2: The neon sign imblazed the entrance of the store.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news imblazed his day with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature imblazed the bottom corner of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight imblazing the stage highlighted the lead singer.

meanings.definition: To decorate or adorn with blazing colors or designs
meanings.sent1: She imblazed her notebook cover with glitter and stickers.
meanings.sent2: The parade float was imblazed with flowers and ribbons.
meanings.sent3: The cake was imblazed with colorful frosting for the party.
meanings.sent4: The garden was imblazed with vibrant blooms in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The costume was imblazing with sequins under the stage lights.
